Class VideoDevice

java.lang.Object
microsim.simulation.component.SimulationComponent
microsim.simulation.component.VideoDevice
public class VideoDevice extends SimulationComponent
Implements a video device that renders a frame buffer by reading from VRAM. Functions in text mode, with bitmap characters read from a file.

      Height of character in text mode.

    • ATLAS_SIZE

      private static final int ATLAS_SIZE
      Width (in characters) of the character atlas. Height is not needed as we are targeting 256 character extended ASCII.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • charAtlas

      private static BufferedImage charAtlas
      Character atlas, read from file "assets/charAtlas.bmp".

    • bus

      private final Bus bus
      Reference to the communication bus the component is mounted on.

    • memory

      private final MemorySpace memory
      Reference to memory space. Used to directly access VRAM via the MemorySpace.getVRAM() method.

    • frame

      private final BufferedImage frame
      Frame buffer to render on.

  • Constructor Details

    • VideoDevice

      public VideoDevice(Bus bus, MemorySpace memory)
      Instantiates video device, taking a reference to the bus it's mounted on and the memory space it should read VRAM from.
      Parameters:
      bus - bus the component is mounted on
      memory - memory space to read from

  • Method Details

    • getFrameWidth

      public static int getFrameWidth()
      Calculates and returns frame buffer width.
      Returns:
      frame buffer width

    • getFrameHeight

      public static int getFrameHeight()
      Calculates and returns frame buffer height.
      Returns:
      frame buffer height

    • step

      public void step()
      Currently unused by video device.
      Specified by:
      step in class SimulationComponent

    • render

      public void render()
      Renders frame buffer from read VRAM. Characters in VRAM are comprised of 2 bytes, with higher byte representing extended ASCII code point, and lower byte representing style.

    • getCharSprite

      private BufferedImage getCharSprite(byte ch, byte st)
      Gets a character from code point and style byte.
      Parameters:
      ch - character code point
      st - style byte
      Returns:
      character image
